items.question: Does the ShipAny package contain a USB drive or my actual data?
items.answer: No. For ultimate security, we never ship USB drives. The package contains only a high-strength physical encrypted credential (Recovery Kit). Your assets remain encrypted in the cloud; the physical credential is the sole "key" to unlock them.

items.question: What happens if DigitalHeirloom's database is hacked?
items.answer: This is the brilliance of our architecture. Even if hackers exfiltrated the entire database, they could read nothing. The critical decryption factors are not on our servers; they reside in the physical credentials sent to your beneficiaries. The algorithmic complexity makes cracking as difficult as finding a specific atom in the universe.

items.question: Does the platform guarantee the quality or integrity of my file content?
items.answer: We guarantee the physical integrity and security of your encrypted data blocks via globally distributed storage. However, as a "Zero-Knowledge" platform, we do not audit or guarantee the internal content quality. We are the vault manufacturers, not content auditors.

items.question: Will my beneficiary still need my Master Password after receiving the physical credential?
items.answer: No. Pro credentials feature "Auto-Parsing" technology. Once the beneficiary scans the encrypted QR code, the system validates identity via the physical medium, automatically bypassing the password input for a friction-less recovery.

items.question: Why emphasize "Physical Credentials" over pure digital passwords?
items.answer: Digital passwords can be compromised via brute force or phishing. Our physical credentials are "non-replicable." This dual-validationâ€”binding digital legacy with physical logistics (ShipAny)â€”ensures that even if a hacker breaches your network, they cannot cross physical space.

items.question: Does decrypting a 2GB asset take a long time?
items.answer: Decryption time depends on the beneficiary's local hardware, not bandwidth. Once the physical credential activates the channel, the system uses Vercel Edge computing for streaming decryption. A 2GB archive can typically be restored within minutes.

items.title: Core Technology: BIP39 & AES-256-GCM
items.description: Afterglow's foundation is built upon the BIP39 Mnemonic standard, the same protocol used by leading cryptocurrency wallets. The system generates a 24-word "Recovery Kit" to protect your Master Password backup. Every piece of data is encrypted using AES-256-GCM, providing the highest level of cryptographic security available for commercial use.

items.title: Physical-Digital Bridge: Powered by ShipAny
items.description: We have bridged the gap between digital data and physical heirlooms through deep integration with ShipAny, a global logistics orchestration platform. Automated Triggers: Real-time monitoring via high-performance Edge Functions. Human-in-the-Loop (HITL): To prevent irreversible shipping errors, every Pro-tier physical dispatch requires manual secondary authorization from the Afterglow administrative dashboard. Privacy-First Logistics: Beneficiary shipping addresses remain encrypted in our database and are only decrypted at the moment the shipping label is generated.

items.title: Why Upgrade to Pro Family Plan?
items.description: For users managing high-value assetsâ€”such as private keys, sensitive legal documents, or priceless family archivesâ€”the Pro Plan offers "Certainty of Delivery": Omni-channel Alerts: Avoid single-point-of-failure risks associated with email-only notifications. Logistics Settlement Engine: Integrated Creem gateway allows beneficiaries to settle shipping fees with a single click. Unlimited Beneficiaries: Perfect for complex estate planning and family trust structures.

items.title: Legal Disclaimer & Best Practices
items.description: While Afterglow provides state-of-the-art technical security, we strongly recommend that users print their Recovery Kit and store it in a secure, fireproof location. Our service serves as a technological supplement to your estate plan and does not replace a legally binding will or testament as defined by your local jurisdiction. Please consult with a legal professional for comprehensive estate planning.
